cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba and 20 mi NW of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north through the Bahamas, then turning northwest and running very near the east coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near or along the east-central coast of Florida (around North Palm Beach to Sebastian Inlet)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (watch upgraded to warning for this section of coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach to Sebastian Inlet, including Lake Okeechobee (covers Palm Beach County)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast from North Palm Beach northward to at least the Flagler/Volusia county line, plus adjoining Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely by early Thursday with hurricane-force winds possible by late Thursday; sustained winds could exceed 74 mph with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the coast near North Palm Beach, producing coastal flooding at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 4–7 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches, capable of producing localized flash flooding at and near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents, large breaking waves in the harbor entrance, possible channel shoaling and berth damage from surge and wave action.
